issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.

fields.summary: HDFS Snapshots should capture point-in-time copies of OPEN files

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: Recently we encountered a case where deletion of HDFS snapshots crashed the client that is currently writing to a file under the same snap root. This open file was previously captured in the snapshot using the immutable open file in snapshot feature "dfs.namenode.snapshot.capture.openfiles".
fields.summary: Verify HDFS snapshot deletion doesn't crash the ongoing file writes

comments.body:
Attached a test to verify snapshot deletions are not crashing the clients that are currently writing to files, which were previously captured in the same snapshot.
[~yzhangal], can you please review the patch?
Thanks [~manojg], the patch looks good to me, except can we add some comments at the snapshot deletion call places to describe the intention, what problem we observed etc. I'm +1 other than that.
Thanks for the quick review [~yzhangal]. Attached v02 patch to extend the test case with more open files, delete open file while the stream is open and added some more comments. Please take a look.
